intro: Desmotrichum triflorum, commonly known as the three-flowered desmotrichum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, cylindrical fruiting structures called cypselae. Desmotrichum triflorum is often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
